1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Huntsman is committed to providing a safe, healthy and environmentally conscious work place for its employees and neighbors. Huntsman Ethyleneamines maintains a Process Safety Management (PSM) program that implements a series of steps to prevent potential hazards associated with the process and assures a well-trained work force. Site specific procedures and manuals are used to assure consistent implementation and enforcement of accidental release and prevention programs. 

2. Regulated Substances
Huntsman Ethyleneamines is located within the boundaries of the DOW Chemical Company Freeport Plant A facility. Huntsman Ethyleneamines produces various Ethyleneamines which are sold to other companies for processing to a final consumer product. There are three (3) regulated substances at the Huntsman Ethyleneamines facility. All three are on the toxic substances list:
Ethylenediamine (EDA) - Final product
Ammonia (anhydrous) - Raw material (pipeline at 99+% NH3, storage tanks at 60% NH3, in process at 98% NH3).  NH3 above the 30% concentration level was included in total anhydrous ammonia calculation.
Ammonia (aqueous) - Raw material

3. General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps 
Following is a brief summary of the elements that Huntsman Ethyleneamines has implemented to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements outlined by EPA as well as with the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard.  

Process Safety Information
Huntsman Ethyleneamines maintains a compilation of current and accurate written safety information to identify and understand the hazards of the process. This includes information pertaining to:

Hazards of regulated substances: For each regulated substance, there is a Safety Data Sheet (SDS) that discusses the physical properties of the chemicals, exposure hazards, the r

equired personal protective equipment and the appropriate first aid and emergency treatment for exposure.

The technology of the process:  Includes a discussion of process chemistry, safe upper and lower limits of operation, analysis of consequences of deviation, and the steps to correct deviations.

Equipment in the process:  Includes such information as materials of construction, diagrams of the piping and instrumentation, safety systems and design codes.

Process Hazard Analysis
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has performed Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)and Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPA)on each process to identify the potential hazards, identify any previous incidents (that had likely potential for catastrophic consequences in the workplace), and to determine the adequacy of the engineering and administrative controls applicable to the hazards and their inter-relationships such as appropriate application of detection methodologies to provide early warning of increases. The PHAs also address consequences of failure of engineering and administrative controls, facility or stationary source siting, human factors and a qualitative evaluation of a range of possible safety and health effects of failure of controls. Huntsman Ethyleneamines utilizes the HAZOP methodology, a recognized and generally accepted method, for identifying and evaluating hazards in the process, and completes Human Factors and Facility Siting checklists during the PHA team meetings. Huntsman Ethyleneamines assigns employees to the HAZOP team who are knowledgeable in the HAZOP methodology and the specific process. The HAZOP team develops recommendations to reduce the potential hazards, which, if approved, are implemented within a reasonable period of time. Huntsman Ethyleneamines will complete a PHA and LOPA Revalidation every 5-years meeting the requirements of the PSM and RMP Standards.

Operating Procedures
Huntsman Ethyleneamines maintains written operating procedures that were developed

in consultation with operators to provide clear instructions for safely conducting activities associated with a covered process. The procedures address steps for all operating phases, safety systems, control measures and precautions to prevent exposures to process hazards. The procedures are reviewed and revised by competent personnel and are certified annually to ensure their accuracy and completeness.

Training
Huntsman Ethyleneamines provides initial training as well as refresher training to employees to assure that the required level of skills and knowledge are maintained. The training emphasizes safety and health hazards, emergency operations, and safe work practices. All operators receive periodic refresher training.

Mechanical Integrity
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has developed a program for maintaining the operating components of the process (including pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown system controls) through the risk based mechanical integrity program. The program is comprised of well-trained personnel who follow maintenance, testing and inspection programs that ensure proper function of process equipment.

Management of Change (MOC)
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has established and implemented a written procedure to manage changes to process chemicals, personnel, technology, equipment, procedures, and any changes to the facility that affect a covered process. The procedure assures that, prior to any change, the following issues are considered: the technical basis for the proposed change, its impact on safety and health, any modifications to operating procedures, the necessary time period for the change, and any authorization requirements. Employees involved in operating a process, as well as maintenance and contract employees whose job will be affected, are informed of and trained in the change. If necessary, the process safety information, the PHA and operating procedures are updated.  

Pre-St

artup Review (PSSR)
Huntsman Ethyleneamines performs Pre-Startup Safety Reviews when the addition of or a modification to the facility is made following the Management of Change Procedure. The Pre-Startup Safety Review confirms, prior to the introduction of highly hazardous chemicals, that construction and equipment is in accordance with design specifications; safety, operating, maintenance and emergency procedures are in place; Management-of-Change requirements are met; and training of employees affected by modifications is complete. A PSSR is also conducted after equipment has been shut down for a significant overhaul, internal inspection, or if it has been down for greater than one month.

Compliance Audit
Huntsman Ethyleneamines performs audits of its compliance with the provisions of its Process Safety Management program. Teams comprised of employees, with appropriate knowledge of audit techniques, process safety and operating experience, conduct audits every three years to verify that the procedures and practices developed are adequate and being followed. The findings of the audit team are reviewed and appropriate corrective actions are implemented and tracked until resolved.

Incident Investigation
Huntsman Ethyleneamines investigates any incidents that resulted in, or could reasonably have resulted in, a release of covered chemicals. The investigation is promptly conducted, commencing within 48 hours of any incident. To perform the investigation, Huntsman Ethyleneamines assembles an incident investigation team consisting of persons with the appropriate knowledge and experience to thoroughly investigate and analyze the incident. A report is prepared at the conclusion of the incident investigation that addresses the incident, the factors that contributed to it, and recommendations resulting from the incident investigation. Huntsman Ethyleneamines has established a system to promptly address and resolve the incident report findings and recommendations an

d to document their resolution. Finally, incident reports are reviewed with all affected personnel.

Employee Participation
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has developed a plan for employee participation in all aspects of its Process Safety Management program. Huntsman Ethyleneamines consults with employees and their representatives on the conduct and development of PHAs and on the development of other elements of the process safety management program. Huntsman Ethyleneamines ensures that all employees have access to PHAs and all other Process Safety Management information.

Hot Work Permit
Huntsman Ethyleneamines employs a Hot Work Permit program for hot work operations conducted on site(hot work generally involves electric or gas welding, cutting, brazing or similar spark-producing operations). If any hot work is performed, Huntsman Ethyleneamines issues a permit that documents the fire prevention and protection requirements for the operation, the date authorized for hot work, and the object on which the work is performed. Hot Work Permits are kept on file until the work is complete and for a minimum of 1 year after the work is complete. 
 
Contractors
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has developed procedures for selecting and ensuring that contractors are competent and knowledgeable and can safely perform their work.  Huntsman Ethyleneamines provides information to them about the hazards that may be present in the work area and has developed appropriate safe work practices. Huntsman Ethyleneamines also evaluates the safety performance and programs of the contractors as a part of their continued employment.

4. Five Year Accident History
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has had no significant accidental releases to report for the 5-Year Accident History. 

5. Emergency Response Program
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has a written emergency response program that contains procedures to be followed in the case of an accidental release. These procedures include steps for informing loca

l emergency response agencies and the public and ensuring the correct use of emergency equipment with properly trained emergency response personnel. Emergency response is provided by DOW chemical company (per contract) since the facility is located on their site.  In addition, Huntsman Ethyleneamines provides training to its emergency response employees who perform emergency response duties and to local emergency responders who may be called on to assist in emergency response. Huntsman Ethyleneamines is actively involved in emergency response activities with local officials and groups. 

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  
Huntsman Ethyleneamines has an on-going commitment to improve safety and protect the environment.  The following health, safety and environmental improvements have been completed:

Implemented behavioral based safety program using Safety Task Analysis Cards (STAC)
Implemented Observation and Intervention (O&I) program 
Implemented Behavioural Science Technology (BST) program
Implemented Self Inspection Teams to identify and correct hazards in the site.
Implemented Knowledge Management Systems (KMS) computer based system to track Management of Change, Incident and Near Miss Investigations, and Actions
Site security was enhanced following the September 11, 2001 terrorist attack.
A Process Control Security Vulnerability Assessment was completed August 2012 along with third party verification.
Internal self audits of  EHS / PSM procedures are conducted on a risk based time schedule.
The site is ISO 14001 certified
Completed EHS Corporate Audit October 2013
Completed PSM Corporate Audit April 2014
Completed Fire Risk Assessment June 2011
Completed Facility Siting Study February 2011
Completed implementation of Risk Based Mechanical Integrity (RBMI) program
